rtac.ac_functionalities.tournament

This module contains classes implementing problem instance solving tournaments by differently configured target algorithms according to the RTAC method utilized.

Functions

tournament_factory(scenario, ta_runner, ...)

Class factory to return the initialized TournamentManager class appropriate to the RTAC method scenario.ac.

Classes

AbstractTournament(scenario, ta_runner, ...)

Tournament(scenario, ta_runner, rtac_data, logs)

Tournament class with functions needed for ReACTR method tournaments.

Tournament_GB()

Class that contains gray-box tournament functions to be inserted into tournament classes if scenario.gray_box is True.

Tournamentpp(scenario, ta_runner, rtac_data, ...)

Tournament class with functions needed for ReACTR method tournaments.
class rtac.ac_functionalities.tournament.AbstractTournament(scenario: Namespace, ta_runner: BaseTARunner, rtac_data: RTACData, logs: RTACLogs)[source]

Bases: ABC

close_tournament() → None[source]

Function that initiates termination of all target algorithm runs.

Parameters:

process (subprocess.Popen) – Target algorithm run process.

pid_alive(pid)[source]
abstract start_tournament(instance: str, contender_dict: dict[slice(<class 'str'>, <class 'rtac.ac_functionalities.rtac_data.Configuration'>, None)], tourn_nr: int) → None[source]

Sets up tournament data and information and starts the tournament with scenario.number_cores configured target algorithms running in paralel with settings according to the RTAC method used.

Parameters:

  • instance (dict[str: Configuration]) – path to the problem instance to solve.

  • contender_dict – Dictonary containing configurations to run in the tournament with configuration id as key and Configuration object as value.

  • tourn_nr (int) – Number of the tournament during this RTAC run.

terminate_run(core: int, process: Popen) → None[source]

Function that enforces termination of a target algorithm run.

Parameters:

  • core (int) – Index of the process in the list of processes.

  • process (subprocess.Popen) – Target algorithm run process.

abstract watch_tournament()[source]

Function to observe the tournament and enforce the timelimit scenario.timeout if reached according to the RTAC method used.

fill_tournament(cores_start: list)[source]
start_tournament(instance: str, contender_dict: dict[slice(<class 'str'>, <class 'rtac.ac_functionalities.rtac_data.Configuration'>, None)], tourn_nr: int, cores_start: list) → None[source]

Sets up tournament data and information and starts the tournament with scenario.number_cores configured target algorithms running in paralel according to the ReACTR method.

Parameters:

  • instance (dict[str: Configuration]) – path to the problem instance to solve.

  • contender_dict – Dictonary containing configurations to run in the tournament with configuration id as key and Configuration object as value.

  • tourn_nr (int) – Number of the tournament during this RTAC run.

class rtac.ac_functionalities.tournament.Tournamentpp(scenario: Namespace, ta_runner: BaseTARunner, rtac_data: RTACData, logs: RTACLogs)[source]

Bases: Tournament

Tournament class with functions needed for ReACTR method tournaments.

rtac.ac_functionalities.tournament.tournament_factory(scenario: Namespace, ta_runner: BaseTARunner, rtac_data: RTACData, logs: RTACLogs) → Tournament[source]

Class factory to return the initialized TournamentManager class appropriate to the RTAC method scenario.ac.

Parameters:

  • scenario (argparse.Namespace) – Namespace containing all settings for the RTAC.

  • ta_runner – Target algorithm runner object.

  • rtac_data (RTACData) – Object containing data and objects necessary throughout the rtac modules.

  • logs – Object containing loggers and logging functions.

Type:

BaseTARunner

Type:

RTACLogs

Returns:

Inititialized Tournament object matching the RTAC method of the scenario.

Return type:

Tournament
